question: What is the purpose of SWORP

answers.text: SWORP stands for the Southwest Oregon Research Project, and it was established to collect and return documents collected by anthropologists and other researchers to some 60 western Oregon tribes as part of the “decolonizing” movement.
SWORP stands for the Southwest Oregon Research Project, and it was established to form a coalition of anthropologists and other researchers to document narratives of 60 Oregon tribes.
SWORP stands for the Southwest Oregon Research Project, and it was established to film ritual practices of some 60 western Oregon tribes as part of the “decolonizing” movement.
SWORP stands for the Southwest Oregon Research Project, and it was established to collect knowledge from 60 western Oregon tribes for the development of a Native studies program.
